showScoreExcerpt:
"Giles Croft’s fluid and inventive staging and Charles Balfour’s scene-shifting lighting transport us from Kabul to San Francisco to Pakistan and across decades. ... All these production elements, along with the high-level acting, combine for a fierce and involving evening in the theater. We are taken to a part of the world few in America probably have experienced, which is what theatre is all about or should be."
